subject: Re: [junit] Exception is swallowed inside tearDown
msgSnippet: ... No. And it doesn t seem to. Do you have a failing testcase that shows how this runBare() variation invokes tearDown() twice? Here s my test: public class
messageBody:
>> /**
>> * Runs the bare test sequence.
>> * This overwrites <code>runBare()</code> in
>> <code>TestCase</code> such that exceptions in <code>tearDown()</code>
>> * are only shown if the test itself didn't throw.
>> */
>> public void runBare() throws Throwable {
>> setUp();
>> try {
>> runTest();
>> } catch (Throwable e) {
>> try {
>> tearDown();
>> } finally {
>> throw e;
>> }
>> }
>> tearDown();
>> }
>
> Do you /really/ want to invoke tearDown() twice?

No. And it doesn't seem to. Do you have a failing testcase that shows
how this runBare() variation invokes tearDown() twice? Here's my test:


public class RunBareTest extends TestCase {
public int tearDownCounter;

public void testRunBare() throws Throwable {
InnerTestWithRunBare testCase = new
InnerTestWithRunBare("successfulTest");
testCase.runBare();
assertEquals(1, tearDownCounter);

testCase = new InnerTestWithRunBare("successfulTest");
testCase.throwInTearDown = true;
try {
testCase.runBare();
fail();
} catch (TearDownException e) {}
assertEquals(1, tearDownCounter);

testCase = new InnerTestWithRunBare("failingTest");
try {
testCase.runBare();
fail();
} catch (AssertionFailedError e) {}
assertEquals(1, tearDownCounter);

testCase = new InnerTestWithRunBare("failingTest");
testCase.throwInTearDown = true;
try {
testCase.runBare();
fail();
} catch (AssertionFailedError e) {}
assertEquals(1, tearDownCounter);
}

public class TearDownException extends Exception {
public TearDownException(String aName) {
super(aName);
}
}

public class InnerTestWithRunBare extends TestCase {
public boolean throwInTearDown = false;

public InnerTestWithRunBare(String aTestName) {
super(aTestName);
}

public void runBare() throws Throwable {
setUp();
try {
runTest();
} catch (Throwable e) {
try {
tearDown();
} finally {
throw e;
}
}
tearDown();
}

public void successfulTest() {
assertTrue(true);
}

public void failingTest() {
assertTrue(false);
}

public void setUp() throws Exception {
super.setUp();
tearDownCounter = 0;
}

public void tearDown() throws Exception {
tearDownCounter++;
if (throwInTearDown)
throw new TearDownException("tearDown Exception");
super.tearDown();
}
}

}


Christian
